properties.name: quickfixj.client.config
properties.description: The location of the configuration file to use to initialize QuickFIX/J client.

properties.name: quickfixj.client.configString
properties.description: The content of the QuickFIX/J initiator configuration file.

properties.name: quickfixj.client.auto-startup
properties.description: Whether the client should get started automatically.

properties.name: quickfixj.client.force-disconnect
properties.description: Whether logged on sessions should be disconnected forcibly when the connector is stopped.

properties.name: quickfixj.client.phase
properties.description: The spring initialisation phase in which the client will start.

properties.name: quickfixj.client.jmx-enabled
properties.description: Whether to register the Jmx MBeans for the client.

properties.name: quickfixj.client.concurrent.enabled
properties.description: Whether to use SocketInitiator or ThreadedSocketInitiator. Default is false (SocketInitiator)

properties.name: quickfixj.client.message-store-factory
properties.description: The message store factory to use. Possible values: cachedfile, file, jdbc, memory, noop, sleepycat

properties.name: quickfixj.client.log-factory
properties.description: The log factory to use. Possible values: compositelog, file, jdbc, slf4j, screen

properties.name: quickfixj.client.concurrent.useDefaultExecutorFactory
properties.description: Whether to use a default ExecutorFactory to create the SocketInitiator (default: `false`)

properties.name: quickfixj.client.concurrent.queueCapacity
properties.description: When using the default ExecutorFactory, the Executor's queue capacity (default: `Integer.MAX_VALUE`)

properties.name: quickfixj.client.concurrent.corePoolSize
properties.description: When using the default ExecutorFactory, the Executor's core pool size (default: `8`)

properties.name: quickfixj.client.concurrent.maxPoolSize
properties.description: When using the default ExecutorFactory, the Executor's max pool size (default: `Integer.MAX_VALUE`)

properties.name: quickfixj.client.concurrent.allowCoreThreadTimeOut
properties.description: when using the default ExecutorFactory, whether to allow core thread timeout on the Executor (default: `true`)

properties.name: quickfixj.client.concurrent.keepAliveSeconds
properties.description: When using the default ExecutorFactory, the Executor's keep alive in seconds (default: `60`)

properties.name: quickfixj.client.concurrent.waitForTasksToCompleteOnShutdown
properties.description: When using the default ExecutorFactory, whether to wait for tasks to complete on shutdown on the Executor (default: `false`)

properties.name: quickfixj.client.concurrent.awaitTerminationSeconds
properties.description: When using the default ExecutorFactory, the Executor's await termination in seconds (default: `0`)

properties.name: quickfixj.client.concurrent.threadNamePrefix
properties.description: When using the default ExecutorFactory, the Executor's thread name prefix (default: `QuickFixJ Spring Boot Starter thread-`)

properties.name: quickfixj.server.config
properties.description: The location of the configuration file to use to initialize QuickFIX/J server.

properties.name: quickfixj.server.configString
properties.description: The content of the QuickFIX/J acceptor configuration file.

properties.name: quickfixj.server.auto-startup
properties.description: Whether the server should get started automatically.

properties.name: quickfixj.server.force-disconnect
properties.description: Whether logged on sessions should be disconnected forcibly when the connector is stopped.

properties.name: quickfixj.server.phase
properties.description: The spring initialisation phase in which the server will start.

properties.name: quickfixj.server.jmx-enabled
properties.description: Whether to register the Jmx MBeans for the server.

properties.name: quickfixj.server.message-store-factory
properties.description: The message store factory to use. Possible values: cachedfile, file, jdbc, memory, noop, sleepycat

properties.name: quickfixj.server.log-factory
properties.description: The log factory to use. Possible values: compositelog, file, jdbc, slf4j, screen

properties.name: quickfixj.server.concurrent.enabled
properties.description: Whether to use SocketAcceptor or ThreadedSocketAcceptor. Default is false (SocketAcceptor)

properties.name: quickfixj.server.concurrent.useDefaultExecutorFactory
properties.description: Whether to use a default ExecutorFactory to create the SocketAcceptor (default: `false`)

properties.name: quickfixj.server.concurrent.queueCapacity
properties.description: When using the default ExecutorFactory, the Executor's queue capacity (default: `Integer.MAX_VALUE`)

properties.name: quickfixj.server.concurrent.corePoolSize
properties.description: When using the default ExecutorFactory, the Executor's core pool size (default: `8`)

properties.name: quickfixj.server.concurrent.maxPoolSize
properties.description: When using the default ExecutorFactory, the Executor's max pool size (default: `Integer.MAX_VALUE`)

properties.name: quickfixj.server.concurrent.allowCoreThreadTimeOut
properties.description: when using the default ExecutorFactory, whether to allow core thread timeout on the Executor (default: `true`)

properties.name: quickfixj.server.concurrent.keepAliveSeconds
properties.description: When using the default ExecutorFactory, the Executor's keep alive in seconds (default: `60`)

properties.name: quickfixj.server.concurrent.waitForTasksToCompleteOnShutdown
properties.description: When using the default ExecutorFactory, whether to wait for tasks to complete on shutdown on the Executor (default: `false`)

properties.name: quickfixj.server.concurrent.awaitTerminationSeconds
properties.description: When using the default ExecutorFactory, the Executor's await termination in seconds (default: `0`)

properties.name: quickfixj.server.concurrent.threadNamePrefix
properties.description: When using the default ExecutorFactory, the Executor's thread name prefix (default: `QuickFixJ Spring Boot Starter thread-`)
